segments.text: Hey , Mary , can you cut that out ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Cut what out I ’ m not doing anything .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The tapping of your pen on your desk . It ’ s driving me crazy .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Fine ! By the way would you mind not slurping your coffee every time you have a cup !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I don ’ t slurp my coffee . And plus , how can you hear it when you ’ re shouting into your phone all the time ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You ’ Ve got to be kidding me ! You ’ re complaining about me talking on the phone when you go out for a cigarette break ten times a day to shoot the breeze ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Look , we have a lot of accumulated anger from working in these conditions , and it ’ s probably okay to let off steam once in a while . But , it ’ s probably not a good idea to keep it up I ’ m willing to forgive and forget and if you are .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Fine . Let's call a truce . I'll try to more considerate and to keep the noise down .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yeah , I ’ ll try to do the same.So , I was wondering you wanna go out to dinner Friday night ?
segments.speaker: S1
